intro: Lepidium meyeri subsp. meyeri, commonly known as the Caucasian rocket, is a herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its fruits are spherical, dry pods that contain several seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils in temperate climates. This species is often cultivated as a leafy vegetable due to its peppery flavor and nutritional value.
